intro: Adesmia incana var. grisea, commonly known as the gray-haired adesmia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its hairy, grayish stems and leaves are adaptations to reduce water loss in harsh environments. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
